derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from late Latin abductio(n-), from the verb abducere (see abduct)

entry.def: If someone is abducted by another person, he or she is taken away illegally, usually using force.

example.ex: His car was held up and he was abducted by four gunmen...
example.tran: 他的车遭遇拦劫，随后他被4名持枪歹徒劫持。

example.ex: She was charged with abducting a six-month-old child.
example.tran: 她被控诱拐一个6个月大的孩子。

means.word_mean: 1. the criminal act of capturing and carrying away by force a family member; if a man's wife is abducted it is a crime against the family relationship and against the wife
2. (physiology) moving of a body part away from the central axis of the body
